title: Capacitor - effect of dielectric on capacitance

content.question: A capacitor initially has a capacitance of <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. If a dielectric with a dielectric constant of <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is added between the plates of the capacitor the new capacitance is <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly expresses the ratio of the new capacitance <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
